#Text=Trinidad TV host bailed on teen rape broadcast charges
#Text=Wednesday , April 25 , 2012
#Text=Trinidad
#Text=' s Ian Alleyene , host of TV6 ' s Crime Watch , has been released on bail .
#Text=He spent the weekend in custody after being charged under the Sexual Offences Act following television broadcasts allegedly showing a mentally ill teenage girl 's rape .
#Text=The controversial case centres around Port of Spain .
#Text=Arrested on April 20 , Alleyne spent the weekend in a hospital and the night of April 23 in police custody .
#Text=He is now free after a Port of Spain magistrate granted his release on TT$ 80,000 ( About US$ 13,300 ) .
#Text=The case is adjourned until May 14 , when the owner of the TV station , Caribbean Communications Network , is summonsed to also appear in court regarding the same broadcasts .
#Text=The charges , filed just days before the statute of limitations expired , allege footage was thrice broadcast in October 2011 which allowed public identification of a rape victim .
#Text=A fourth charge alleges Alleyne , who 's lawyer says has no previous convictions , obstructed the police investigation .
#Text=it is just a travesty of justice
#Text=— Ian Alleyne
#Text=The fourth charge relates to an incident last week at Caribbean Communications Network 's Independence Square premises in Port of Spain .
#Text=Alleyne was ultimately arrested publicly but police claim they first asked him to attend a police station .
#Text=Alleyne was taken to court early yesterday morning where he appeared before Chief Magistrate Marcia Ayers-Caesar in a hearing witnessed by journalists and his family .
#Text=Thirty minutes after bail was granted he had posted it and was freed , meeting supporters protesting against the prosecution outside the courthouse .
#Text=" [ I]f you go back to the genesis of this entire incident you will realise it is just a travesty of justice , " he told the press .
#Text=Walking through Port of Spain upon his release , he twice mounted tables to address following supporters .
#Text=" They can lock me up for a month , they can lock me up for two months , but I will still come out and will continue my fight for you .
